file_content.text: We're going to make those Flesh Raiders pay.
It won't be much longer. We'll protect Jerridan until the skimmer comes....
With the area cleared, we'll finish our trials no matter what.
The beacon's set so I suppose that's it. We're going home.
Once you've scared the Flesh Raiders, we'll wait to make our move. We're going to hurt them and finish our trial.
How's he looking?
He should be resting in the Jedi Temple. But if you're determined to press on... I can help him along.
Thank you, my friend.
Give him the last of the kolto if you have to. We'll fight again soon.
Hey! Good to see another Padawan alive out here. You're lucky those creatures haven't caught you yet.
You're talking about the Flesh Raiders?
Creatures?
They're hiding everywhere....
I've been searching for you. What happened out here?
You must be the lost Padawans.
Knew it. Knew they'd send rescuers....
Those animals are no threat.
They couldn't take us either, and let me tell you, they tried.
We came seeking knowledge of the Jedi Code. The Flesh Raiders interrupted our trial.
We tried to run. Eventually we ran right into one. Turns out we surprised it.
I've never fought like that in my life. We killed it, but Jerridan was badly injured.
I thought you didn't have combat training--the Masters wanted you out of harm's way.
I'm surprised you killed one.
Your friend--how serious is the wound?
Is he okay?
It pains him greatly. He should not be moving. It is not the Jedi way to seek battle and revenge while a man suffers.
One Flesh Raider did this? You really can't handle yourselves, can you?
What a sorry bunch.
We're not warriors. Besides, it is not the Jedi way to seek revenge.
That's your opinion, Mennaus. It's not what we decided.
Training or not, a bunch of animals won't keep us from becoming Jedi.
We're going to fight them until all three of us are finished with our trials.
Listen to yourself--all this rage... this isn't how Jedi behave. You can finish your trial another time.
Jedi aren't vengeful.
I'm not sure about all this.
Look what they did to Jerridan. We can't give up now.
Isn't she right? Jedi don't give up... do they?
She is wrong. Remember the Jedi Code: "There is no passion, there is serenity...."
I have to say, I wasn't expecting to hear that. But I approve.
I like your attitude.
Fear isn't fit for a Jedi. And since we lack combat skills, we're hoping the Force will guide us.
As it has guided you here, perhaps. Remember the Jedi Code: "There is no passion, there is serenity...."
That's enough, Mennaus!
If you want to help us--we could use you. Help make the Flesh Raiders pay.
You're walking a dangerous path. You and your friends need to get back to camp while you still can.
You're going home--now.
We can't do that. We can't just give up!
Avitla, listen, this is our best opportunity to survive this.
But we're so close to finishing the trial....
No. We are not.
I see you have a signal beacon. Leave it for us, and as soon as we have gathered our things, we will signal for a ride back.
All right. Let's teach those monsters to stay out of the Gnarls.
Let's get revenge.
Here's what we need, then--if you can take the Flesh Raiders head-on, we can come around and flank them.
Together, we'll show them what it means to be Jedi. We can beat them.
We can, and we will. Let's go.
Agreed.
You probably won't make it.
We won't die. Even if we did... we'd die proud.
Whatever you say.
Do what you can. We'll be watching for our opportunity to move.
When you're finished, let the watchman at camp know we're coming back. It just may take us a while.
May the Force be with you.
This is wrong. Search your feelings.
You--be careful out here. The Gnarls aren't safe anymore.
Just go. Get those beacons set up so we can evacuate Jerridan.
